feed.title: SAP Community - SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud
feed.subtitle: SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Request for guidance to create an Overview Page (OVP) in SAP Public Cloud
entry.content:
Dear SAP Experts,

I have a few questions about creating an Overview Page (OVP) in SAP Public Cloud:

  1. Is it possible to create an Overview Page using the Fiori Launchpad?

  2. Can an Overview Page be created using Business Application Studio (BAS), SAP Web IDE, or Visual Studio Code? Which approach is recommended for SAP Public Cloud?

I am trying to create an Overview Page and cards in a BTP trial account, but no data appears. I have followed several blog posts that describe the steps, yet I still cannot get the OVP to work. Could you please provide a step-by-step guide for creating an OVP in SAP Public Cloud and explain the required BTP configuration in detail.

Thank you very much for your help

entry.title: Check to Use customized Calendar-Year as Fiscal Year with Friday Month-End (instead of K4)
entry.content:
Hi Team, 

        We are currently using fiscal year variant K4 (Calendar Year: 12 normal + 4 special periods) in our DEV & QA tenant.
Our business requirement is to keep a calendar-year fiscal year (Jan–Dec)   but have each month end on a Friday . If the last calendar day of the month is not a Friday, , the month should extend to the following Friday, , even if that Friday, falls in the next calendar month. This “Friday,  month-end” rule must apply consistently for all months and years.

 

We need SAP confirmation on supportability in S/4HANA (Public Cloud) and the exact enablement steps. Our Production system is not yet set up and there are no productive postings, so we want to implement this now if possible.

 

Hence requesting to provide your expertise advise in this at the earliest.


--- Steps to Reproduce ---

  1. Use SSCUI DIGITS - Maintain Fiscal Year
  2. Use "SZ-Configurable template variant" or New Entries
  3. Configure the each period with ending PERSON_NAME
  4. Assign that FY Variant to Company Code - SSCUI-DIGITS (we are not able to change here)





------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Restrict users from editing a parked invoice
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I am working on SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, and my client needs to restrict the possibility of editing parked invoices for some users. They don't use an approval workflow and don't want to, so I need to know if it's possible to add a restriction in a role to achieve that. If yes, what would be that role and that restriction? Or do you now another way to do it?

Thank you in advance and best regards,

Ornella

entry.title: Question about scope item 3L5 and 3Y0 (Liquidity Planning on SAC)
entry.content:
Dear SAP Cloud Public Edition experts,

I would like to ask your support regarding the scope item 3L5 and 3Y0 with SAC integrations.

3L5  Liquidity Planning (3L5) --- S4HC
3Y0 SAP Liquidity Planning for SAP S/4HANA Cloud (3Y0) --- SAC

As far as I confirmed the scope item dependencies,  there is no prerequisite to activate those scope items.
However, I was wondering if another scope item "J78" (Advanced Cash Operations (J78)) is needed as prerequisite.

Question: Is the scope item "J78" activation an option for 3L5 and 3I0 ? or mandatory or recommendation ?

My colleague who is working to set up for SAC integration on "Starter" system found no "technical" problem without J78 activation.

I would appreciated if some feedbacks or guidance be provided from the SAP experts.

Thank you for your support & Kindly Regards,
 Ai Takahashi

entry.title: Understanding the Behavior of the Payment Block in the Manage Supplier Master App
entry.content:
In the Manage Supplier Master app, what does the Payment Block control?

I am conducting tests in a Japanese system environment, and even when I select the checkbox for the Payment Block, it seems that payment postings can still be made. Additionally, toggling the checkbox does not appear to change the Status in the Manage Payment Blocks app, so I am having trouble understanding its behavior.

Could you please explain what the Payment Block is intended to control? Also, which application should I use to verify its actual behavior?

Thank you in advance for your support.

entry.title: How to Create Material Document Movements with Reference to Purchase Order in SAP public cloud (3SL)
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I am working on SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud (3-System Landscape) and I have a requirement to create material document movements with reference to a Purchase Order (PO).

Could you please guide me on the following points:

  • How to create Goods Receipt (GR) or other material document movements with reference to a PO in the Public Cloud environment?

  • Are there any standard released APIs or CDS views available to post material documents in the Public Cloud?

  • Can this process be handled via a custom RAP application or background job using available public APIs?

  • Any example implementation or official documentation/blog references would be very helpful.

   Thank you in advance

Thanks & Regards,
Sanjay

entry.title: Selecting service plan for SAP Ariba Central invoice management
entry.content:
Hi all

We want to have Peppol e-invoicing solution in Germany.

Invoice flow for inbound invoices will be Supplier > Peppol Network> DRC > SAP Ariba CIM > S/4 HANA Public cloud.

During integration, we need to choose suitable service plan for SAP Ariba Central Invoice Management (CIM).

CIM and S/4 public cloud integrate seamlessly and are covered under scope item 4N6.

When read set up instructions for 4N6, it says that the set up by booster by default chooses service plan as ''scim''.

https://help.sap.com/docs/link-disclaimer?site=https%3A%2F%2Fsupport.sap.com%2Fcontent%2Fdam%2FSAAP%2FSol_Pack%2FS4C%2FLibrary%2FSetup%2F4N6_Set-Up_EN_XX.pdf

 

however, in the Peppol integration SAP content , it asks us to choose CIM service plan as ''Inbound - drc''

https://help.sap.com/docs/cloud-edition/sap-document-and-reporting-compliance-cloud-edition/integrate-cloud-edition-with-sap-s-4hana-cloud

Whereas a BTP account global administrator or a person setting up the system, when he accesses SAP BTP cockpit, he sees below service plans to choose from - 

Thus getting very much confused about which plan to choose from.

Another question is - in set up instructions 4N6, it clearly says that there are 2 licenses viz. a) SAP Ariba Central Invoice Management and b) SAP Ariba Central Invoice Management, Inbound Processing Module.

I want guidance upon on what basis we can decide whether to take Inbound processing module license or not to take...what are its specific uses which are not included in SAP Ariba Central Invoice Management license.

Help in this regards will be greatly appreciated..

Note - I have been reading lots and lots of content related to SAP ARiba central invoice management from SAP but not getting answers to my queries.

Regards

Megha

entry.title: How to apply filter for [specific criteria] in SAP (when standard filter is not available)?
entry.content:
I am trying to filter data in the app, but the standard filter menu does not show my required field 

Steps I’ve tried:

  • Clicked “Adapt Filters” and checked all available fields.

Is there a workaround to apply a custom filter for fields not available in the standard filter menu?

  • Can a Key User add this field via Extensibility tools?

  • Is it possible to request a CDS View or enhancement for this scenario?

  • Any best practices for achieving refined results in SAP Public Cloud

Appreciate your guidance or procedural steps to enable my required filter option—or advice on alternative approaches.

For Example:

In the app "Manage Sales Inquires", there is no product filter.

Best Regards,

Nithin Pranesh

entry.title: Can we suspend interfaces by EventMesh?
entry.content:
Dear SAP specialists,

Currently we are implementing S/4HANA cloud Public Edition and BTP Integration Suite.
Most outbound interfaces are triggerred by EventMesh technology. 

To consider daily operation, our client wants to have offline time (to profibit input operation).
It comes from the point to keep consistency of the data among several interfaces.

Can we suspend interfaces during several hours?
After resuming, the data which is created during the time should be interfaced.

Thanks and best regards,

Masatomo Makino

entry.title: Currency Valuation Discrepancy on cleared Items
entry.content:
Hello, 

We are experiencing a currency valuation issue on our SAP S4PC environment.

Context : 
1. Advance valuation activated for currency.
2. Persistent discrepancy identified between balance and line items.
3. We are approaching year-end closing and cannot have these discrepancies on foreign currency transactions.
4. The affected docuement are SA transactions.

Issue identified : 

1. Systematic variance between trial balance and line items.
2. The discrepancy disappears only when we exlude cleared items for trial balance. 
3. The balance becomes consistent with line items once cleared items are excluded.


Why do cleared items create discrepancies in advance valuation currency ? and how can we resolve this ? 

Thanks, 
Best regards,

N Be

entry.title: Problem with PDF generation in SAP: address fields incorrectly defined as numeric
entry.content:
Dear experts,

I work with form processing in SAP Cloud ERP in conjunction with Adobe Livecycle Designer. I have now encountered a problem and hope you can help me.

I have created my own invoice form template based on the SAP standard invoice form template. This template requires two address blocks (ship-to-party and bill-to-party). The eight fields in the respective address blocks are text fields in which the binding of the respective business partner (bill-to-party or ship-to-party) has been provided with address lines 1-8.

After creating an invoice in the system, no PDF can be generated and I get an error message saying that this is a rendering problem. According to the error message, the fields (address lines 2-4 in the business partner) are declared as float, i.e., numeric, and therefore cannot be filled with alphanumeric values “string” (as is usual for an address).

However, since I need this option in order to be able to display Spanish addresses correctly, for example, I now need help.

If you need further information or screenshots, etc., please let me know! Otherwise, I would be grateful for any suggestions for a solution.

entry.title: Sales employee in Inquiry and Quotation
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

Is there any options to take report of Sales quotation and Sales Inquiry with Sales employee. In Manage Sales Inquiry and Manage Sales Quotation there is no standard option to add the Sales employee field to filters and Settings in Public cloud. My client needs to track report of how many Quotation and details has been given by Sales employee's. Can you please guide me is there any solution for this or Why SAP has not given the Standard option to filter the Sales employee for Quotation and Inquiry.

Best regards,

Dinesh U

entry.title: How to enable API_FORM_PRINT_SRV in S/4HANA Public Cloud
entry.content:
We would like to request activation of the standard API API_FORM_PRINT_SRV in our SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud tenant.

Business Context

After performing Goods Receipt, the user needs to generate and print HU labels for internal storage and identification purposes.

We have already designed a form template named YY1_EWM_HU_LABEL, based on the standard data source FDP_HU_SHIPPINGLABEL_SRV (Handling Unit Label).

This form needs to be rendered and printed directly from our custom Fiori app.

Requested Action

How to access to the API_FORM_PRINT_SRV service (part of SAP Forms Service by Adobe Integration API), or advise an equivalent successor API that allows:

Server-side rendering of the HU Label (Adobe Form).

Automatic release of the generated output to a print queue (e.g., HU_LABEL_Q) managed via Cloud Print Manager.

Optional retrieval of rendered PDF for preview via Fiori UI.

Business Process: Goods Receipt and Handling Unit Label Printing

Form Template: YY1_EWM_HU_LABEL (Data Source: FDP_HU_SHIPPINGLABEL_SRV)

Expected Behavior: Server-side PDF rendering and print queue integration for HU Label forms from a custom Fiori UI5 application

The API API_FORM_PRINT_SRV is not currently visible or available in our tenant under Communication Arrangements or SAP API Business Hub.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Entity PRODUCTPURCHASEORDERTEXT is not maintainable in Product API error
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I am working with the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and trying to perform a POST operation using the Product (API_PRODUCT_2) API.
However, I’m receiving the following error response:

{
  "error": {
    "code": "CMD_PROD_RAP/011",
    "message": "Entity PRODUCTPURCHASEORDERTEXT is not maintainable",
    "target": "_ProductPurchaseOrderText(Product='102010000009',TextObjectType='BEST',Language='EN')",
    "details": [
      {
        "code": "CMD_PROD_RAP/011",
        "message": "Entity PRODUCTPROCUREMENT is not maintainable",
        "target": "_ProductProcurement"
      },
      {
        "code": "CMD_PROD_RAP/011",
        "message": "Entity PRODUCTPLANTPROCUREMENT is not maintainable",
        "target": "_ProductPlant(Product='102010000009',Plant='CN7A')/_ProductPlantProcurement"
      }
    ],
    "innererror": {
      "ErrorDetails": {
        "@SAP__common.Application": {
          "ComponentId": "LO-MD-MM",
          "ServiceRepository": "SRVD_A2X",
          "ServiceId": "API_PRODUCT_2",
          "ServiceVersion": "0001"
        },
        "@SAP__common.TransactionId": "86545C3DDA130010E0068E7D20C1703B",
        "@SAP__common.Timestamp": "20251009154237.258522",
        "@SAP__common.ErrorResolution": {
          "Analysis": "Use ADT feed reader 'SAP Gateway Error Log' or run transaction /IWFND/ERROR_LOG on SAP Gateway hub system and search for entries with the timestamp above for more details",
          "Note": "See SAP Note 1797736 for error analysis"
        }
      }
    }
  }
}

My Question:

  • Why are these entities (PRODUCTPURCHASEORDERTEXT, PRODUCTPROCUREMENT, PRODUCTPLANTPROCUREMENT) not maintainable through the post API?

  • Are there any restrictions in the Public Cloud Edition for maintaining these sub-entities via API?

  • Is there an alternative API or approach to update these product procurement or purchase order text details?

 

I’ve already checked the payload structure and API reference documentation, and the JSON is valid. The base product entity is being read successfully — the error occurs only during the POST operation.

Any insights or SAP Notes related to this behavior would be highly appreciated.

Thanks in advance,
Janarthanan R.
